chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
m: X -> X -> X
u: X
Hmonoid: monoid_theory m u
n: nat

Goal:
mscal n u = u

Premises:
mscal = fun (n : nat) (x : X) => ∑ n (fun _ : nat => x) : nat -> X -> X Arguments mscal _%nat_scope
monoid_theory : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> X) -> X -> Prop
VectorSpec.eta : forall v : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n), v = VectorDef.cons ?A (VectorDef.hd v) ?n (VectorDef.tl v) where ?A : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat |- Type] ?n : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat |- nat]
monoid_unit_l : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m u x = x
monoid_unit_r : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m x u = x
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
monoid_assoc : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n0 : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n0) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n0 : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n0), P n0 (VectorDef.cons ?A h n0 t)) -> forall (n0 : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n0)), P n0 v where ?A : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat |- Type]
mscal_0 : forall x : X, mscal 0 x = u
msum_0 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 0 f = u
mscal_S : forall (n : nat) (x : X), mscal (S n) x = x ⊕ mscal n x
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF ->...-> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
Nat.le_alt = fun n m : nat => exists p : nat, p + n = m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.le_alt (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
mscal_1 : forall x : X, mscal 1 x = x
max_l : forall n m : nat, m <= n -> Init.Nat.max n m = n
Nat.max_l : forall n m : nat, m <= n -> Nat.max n m = n
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : Z => (m + - n)%Z : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
Nat.lt_1_l : forall n m : nat, 0 < n -> n < m -> 1 < m
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.mul_pos_pos : forall n m : nat, 0 < n -> 0 < m -> 0 < n * m
Nat.mul_neg_neg : forall n m : nat, n < 0 -> m < 0 -> 0 < n * m
Nat.mul_neg_pos : forall n m : nat, n < 0 -> 0 < m -> n * m < 0
Nat.mul_pos_neg : forall n m : nat, 0 < n -> m < 0 -> n * m < 0
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
